author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with a capital letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in lowercase
- The following dependencies do not have a compat entry that has an upper bound: Interpolations, Plots, julia

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->

I added upper compat bounds for all deps in the current master branch.
I was not aware that the package name should end with a lowercase. How severe is this? Should I rename the package?

> I added upper compat bounds for all deps in the current master branch.

Can you retrigger Registrator? That will update this PR.

>  I was not aware that the package name should end with a lowercase. How severe is this? Should I rename the package?

No, its just a heuristic, you can keep the name if you want. However, see https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1, which might suggest the name `ABCanalysis` (or `ABCAnalysis`) since this is a port of an existing software.

It is up to you, keep the name if you want!

> No, its just a heuristic, you can keep the name if you want. However, see https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1, which might suggest the name ABCanalysis (or ABCAnalysis) since this is a port of an existing software.

That won't work, because the module contains a `ABCanalysis` struct.

Your `new package` pull request does not meet the following guidelines for auto-merging:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with a capital letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in lowercase

Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Any ETA of when this will be merged?
